user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const OS_SockAddr_t *Addr)
{
    int                             os_result;
    socklen_t                       addrlen;
    const struct sockaddr *         sa;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    sa = (const struct sockaddr *)&Addr->AddrData;

    switch (sa->sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
            break;
#endif
        default:
            addrlen = 0;
            break;
    }

    if (addrlen == 0)
    {
        return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }

    os_result = bind(impl->fd, sa, addrlen);
    if (os_result < 0)
    {
        OS_DEBUG("bind: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_file_internal_record_t OS_impl_filehandle_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    size_t            ActualLength; /**< @brief Length of the actual address data */
    OS_SockAddrData_t AddrData;     /**< @brief Abstract Address data */
} OS_SockAddr_t
...
typedef struct
{
    int  fd;
    bool selectable;
} OS_impl_file_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
#define OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS (-34)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I examined the entire function and the related definitions for language/compiler-specific extensions. No compiler-specific extensions are present. Specifically:

- No GCC/Clang/MSVC extension tokens are used (no __attribute__, __declspec, __builtin_*, __extension__, __typeof__, asm, nested functions, statement-expressions ({:}), or pragma pragmas specific to a compiler).
- The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET uses only standard preprocessor and address-of/dereference operations; the call site passes *token which yields an lvalue and &(*token) is standard C.
- The variadic macro syntax OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) is C99-standard variadic-macro usage, not a compiler extension, and the invocation OS_DEBUG("bind: %s\n", strerror(errno)) is a valid use.
- Casts (const struct sockaddr *)&Addr->AddrData, use of socklen_t, errno/strerror, AF_INET/AF_INET6, and the bind() call are POSIX/standard library usages, not compiler-language extensions covered by MISRA C Rule 1.2 as specified in your instruction.
- The conditional inclusion via #ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 and the empty #define OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 are preprocessor features, not language extensions.

Therefore there are no fragments to report for investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (language extensions).
